results.title: How clear the hot springs bubble
results.brief_description: Iceland is a country of great contrasts. Under glaciers and close by ice-capped peaks are many examples of thermal activity. In the volcanic belt which stretches across the island there are high temperature zones with bubbling mud pools. These springs are used for swimming pools, hot houses for growing vegetables and flowers and for heating homes.

results.title: How Britain votes
results.brief_description: The General Election of 1950 won by Atlee, is taken as an example to illustrate the functioning of the British electoral system. Footage of the election machinery is shown; the selection of candidate; the work of his local election agent; canvassing the electorate; policing; the work of the returning officer; Polling Day; announcement of the results; State opening of Parliament by George V.

results.title: How blood clots
results.brief_description: Shows what role each part of the blood playsin the clotting process. Follows the actual generation of platelets from large cells found in the bone marrow.

results.title: How black is black (A)
results.creator_credit: Eat Carpet, LOUD Media Festival of Youth Culture and the Arts, SBS-TV and Jade Woods
results.brief_description: How much Aboriginal are you?, we are asked by a group of indigenous Australian children. “How black is black” questions the issue of blackness and how much Aboriginality is assumed to be an issue of skin colour. Through a series of stills and colourful action sequences, thirteen year old director Jade Woods presents a film about identity, friendship and race. Soundtrack provided by the Sisters Underground.

results.title: How behavior grows
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Arnold Gesell
results.brief_description: Documentary on the study of the patterning of prone pregression. This study which took 20 years in 23 phases focuses on the progress of a baby’s movements up to 18 months old.

results.title: How astronomers study the universe. - 2nd ed.
